problem.p: In the script using 'compose' in Dan's demo, if instead of:
compose (first word) (all but first) of 'Build Your Own Blocks'
compose (item 2 of) (sentence to list) of 'Build Your Own Blocks'

div.p: The sentence to list block takes it's word in our sentence and makes it an item of a list. In our case, we would get a list as so: [Build, Your, Own, Blocks]. Then the second item of that list is called, so the compose function returns 'Your'.
